note.name: note-2
note.title: Want a different top flow for this block? <click here>
note.text:
Want to change the top flow for this block?
Either edit this flow or use another flow, including the sample flows included in the scripts_block/lcrm_setup directory.
Use the "Block Flow Manager" to configure a new top flow 1) Open the "Block Flow Manager" (found as the wrench icon located in toolbar or under "File" menu) 2) "Add existing flow" and navigate to locate the xml flow file to add (usually in scripts_block/lcrm_setup) 3) Set a flow as the "Top Flow" by selecting it and using the icon "Make Selected flow the TopFlow" located on the right pane 4) Set a "Flow Goal" by selecting the target task from the lower pane and using the right icon "Make selected Task the FlowGoal" 5) save (which will write the scripts_block/conf/block.xml with your config)

note.name: note-3
note.title: Design Compiler
note.text: These are example tasks which run the RM Design Compiler tasks. Make sure the RM was configured with Lynx Compatible set TRUE. If the RM was not configured for hierarchical design, the dc_top task will not have a proper script dc_top.tcl to reference and the flow will show errors. You can either delete the dc_top task from the flow or download the RM with hierarchical design enabled.

note.name: note-4
note.title: DC Explorer
note.text:
This task uses the same scripts as DC but runs using the DC Explorer for faster runtimes and handling of dirty data, including infeasible paths.
Make sure the RM was configured with Lynx Compatible set to TRUE and DC Explorer compatible set to TRUE. DC Explorer execution will fail if you are not using the DC Explorer compatible version of the scripts. If the RM was not configured for hierarchical design, the dc_top task will not have a proper script dc_top.tcl to reference and the flow will show errors. You can either delete the dc_top task from the flow or download the RM with hierarchical design enabled.
